favorites.title: Favorites List
addFavorite.title: Add to Favorite Files
fdCodeWs.title: Open Workspace from code-ws via Fd
fd#diffWs.title: Diff files in Workspace via Fd
rgFavorites.title: Ripgrep in Favorites (Like fd -t | rg)
rgws.title: Ripgrep in Workspace
rgre.title: Ripgrep Using Regex
rgWithFd.title: Ripgrep via Fd (Like fd -t f | rg)
rgWithFdDir.title: Ripgrep via Fd (Like fd -t d | rg)

category.favorites.description: Describe the category of the favorites
path.favorites.win32.description: Describe the location of the favorites file in Windows
path.favorites.darwin.description: Describe the location of the favorites file in MacOS
path.favorites.linux.description: Describe the location of the favorites file in Linux
compare.external.enabled.description: Please choose whether to use an external Diff program.
compare.external.program.description: Enter the location of the external Diff program. [For example: C:\Program Files (x86)\WinMerge\WinMergeU.exe]
compare.external.option.description: Enter the option of the external Diff program
everything.count.description: Number of results received from Everything (default: 5000)
everything.limitOpenFile.description: Number of files that can be opened at once from results received from Everything (default: 100)
everything.exclude.enabled.description: Whether to exclude files when searching with Everything
everything.exclude.text.description: List of files to exclude when searching with Everything
everything.excludePatterns.description: Enter the directory pattern to exclude from Everything
fd.internal.enabled.description: Whether to use the included fd program
fd.program.win32.description: Describe the location of the fd program in Windows
fd.program.darwin.description: Describe the location of the fd program in MacOS, eg: /bin/fd
fd.program.linux.description: Describe the location of the fd program in Linux, eg: /bin/fd
fd.path.win32.description: Set the default search directory in the Fd program in Windows. (Separator: ;)
fd.path.darwin.description: Set the default search directory in the Fd program in MacOS. (Separator: ;)
fd.path.linux.description: Set the default search directory in the Fd program in Linux. (Separator: ;)
fd.default.option.description: Set default options for fd program. [-H: Search hidden files and directories, -s: Case-sensitive search (default: smart case)]
fd.excludePatterns.description: Enter the Exclude Pattern for Fd. For example, to exclude files with the extensions bak and tmp, enter ['*.bak', '*.tmp']
rg.internal.enabled.description: Whether to use the included ripgrep program
rg.excludePatterns.description: Enter the Exclude Pattern for Ripgrep. For example, to exclude files with .git and .vscode, enter ['.git', '.vscode']
rg.input.preferType.description: Change to your preferred search method. Input: Searches one at a time. (Try again to change the search term) Incremental: Attempts to search with each input. (Not recommended as it consumes a lot of resources) [Target: Ripgrep workspace and Ripgrep Directory]
rg.program.win32.description: Describe the location of the ripgrep program in Windows
rg.program.darwin.description: Describe the location of the ripgrep program in MacOS, eg: /bin/rg
rg.program.linux.description: Describe the location of the ripgrep program in Linux, eg: /bin/rg
rg.count.description: Number of results received from Ripgrep (default: 500)
rg.default.option.description: Set default options for ripgrep program
rg.matchColor.darkTheme.description: Set the background color for strings that match patterns in ripgrep. [Dark Theme]
rg.matchColor.lightTheme.description: Set the background color for strings that match patterns in ripgrep. [Light Theme]
rg.custom1.description: Please provide the custom1 configuration for ripgrep.
rg.custom2.description: Please provide the custom2 configuration for ripgrep.
rg.custom3.description: Please provide the custom3 configuration for ripgrep.
rg.custom4.description: Please provide the custom4 configuration for ripgrep.
rg.custom5.description: Please provide the custom5 configuration for ripgrep.
